titleStmt.title: The True narrative of the proceedings at the sessions-house in the Old-Bayly which began on Wednesday the 26th of this instant May, 1680 and ended on Fryday the 28th following giving an account of most of the remarkable trials there, viz. for high-treason, murders, fellonies, and burglaries &c., with a particular relarion [sic] of their names and the places of their committing their facts, with the number of those condemned to die, burnt in the hand, and to be whipt.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
